frontmatter.title: Do you keep your inbox as a task list only?
frontmatter.content:
Most people don’t manage their inbox effectively. Emails should be treated as a list to do. As you complete a task you can just delete the email.

Your inbox should only contain ['tasks'](https://www.ssw.com.au/rules/dones-do-you-use-email-for-tasks-only-not-communication), that are actionable items on your list of things to do. Everything that is in your 'Inbox' (including sub-folders) should only be to-do items.

So do it now, delete all emails you have done. If you want to keep some for reference, move them to a new folder that is not in your inbox.

frontmatter.title: Do you know the 8 Steps to Scrum?
frontmatter.content: Scrum may seem complex at first, but it’s simpler than you think. Follow these 8 easy steps to master it.

frontmatter.title: Getting Started - Do you know the Scrum guide?
frontmatter.content:
Everyone who will be involved in Scrum (pigs and chickens alike) should have read and understood the Scrum guide.

Understanding the concepts of Scrum is easy... implementing it is hard!
